docstr:
`MODULO` — Modulo function ### Description `MODULO(A,P)` computes the `A` modulo `P`. ### Syntax `RESULT = MODULO(A, P)` ### Arguments . | `P` | Shall be a scalar of the same type and kind as `A`. It shall not be zero. ### Return value The type and kind of the result are those of the arguments.
**If `A` and `P` are of type `INTEGER`:** `MODULO(A,P)` has the value `R` such that `A=Q*P+R`, where `Q` is an integer and `R` is between 0 (inclusive) and `P` (exclusive). **If `A` and `P` are of type `REAL`:** `MODULO(A,P)` has the value of `A - FLOOR (A / P) * P`.
The returned value has the same sign as P and a magnitude less than the magnitude of P. ### Example ``` program test_modulo   print *, modulo(17,3)   print *, modulo(17.5,5.5)   print *, modulo(-17,3)   print *, modulo(-17.5,5.5)   print *, modulo(17,-3)   print *, modulo(17.5,-5.5) end program ``` ### Standard Fortran 95 and later ### Class Elemental function ### See also MOD
